Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff but Terribly Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jamie B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with my family at the Harmony Hotel in Istanbul for 3 nights and found the hotel very disapointing. We had a family room, two rooms with a door connecting. The space was very small, there was little room to walk around the bed to get to the bathroom or to set a suitcase. Also, the noise was incredible - the hotel is on the main route leading into Sultanahmet, immediately next to the train tracks. Between the endless traffic on the road and the trains passing by late into the night sleep was a challenge. The staff was very friendly and accomodating which was really the only redeeming characteristic. Definitely recommend staying a bit farther up the hill, away from the immediate street and train track noise. Check out Flamingo Apart - similar price, but great big rooms on a quiter street just steps from the Blue Mosque, etc... Wish that we stayed there the entire time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Agnes2805
Reviews.Content: With my husband we just came back from our trip to Istanbul. We stayed at Harmony Hotel for five nights. We had a excellentl time! The staff is wonderful and friendly! The hotel is located close to the blue mosque, in an excellent, safe area. On the rooftop of the hotel we ate breakast looking at the sea. We recommed the hotel to everyone! When we visit Istanbul we will again stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The noiseist hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Haybaywill
Reviews.Content: The main problem with this hotel is the noise - the room we stayed in was literally on top of the main road, railway track and reception (which has a very noisy bird in a cage). We hardly slept for 3 nights but didn't want to complain as no one was very friendly so we felt we had no chance of being moved. We just did not feel welcome there. Other guests had there tv's on so load, and were not considerate at all. Noise levels aside, the room was clean and the beds nice. Breakfast average and location perfect for us. One thing I couldn't understand - they do not allow guests! We met with a friend but was not even allowed to show him the room! But it was not a problem whatsoever at his hotel. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed it very very much.”
Reviews.Author: EMAN24427
Reviews.Content: Very cosy with great breakfast on terrace. Very goodlocation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Ali_Max_11
Reviews.Content: Very clean...simple and staff friendly. The view from the terrace is very nice, and nice breakfast too. you will not hear the noise of the train in night because you will be too tiered after you will spend all day visiting all those beautyfull places in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and I wouldn't hesitate to return there at any time”
Reviews.Author: melisadupljak
Reviews.Content: The people at this hotel made me feel so welcomed. I didn't feel like I was in a foreign country, I felt like I was home. This place was beautiful and the workers were amazing. I would like to thank you guys for everything, I couldn't of had a better holiday.

Reviews.Title: “very warm, friendly and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: cappadociaRome
Reviews.Content: A very welcoming hotel with staff who go out of their way to be helpful, as far as the hotel services are concerned and also, who provide ample information about how to visit Istanbul ( and beyond ). The hotel has a fine terrace with a pleasant view on the sea. Would be better if the hotel were equipped with a lift as the stairs are a bit steep. Very good, abundant breakfast. Free internet use is an asset. Overall we have excellent memories of the hotel. It should be said however that though the location is ideal for those interested in visiting the main monuments, the hotel stands at the beginning of a very steep slope which demands some effort to reach the top, though it is only a very short walk, where one finds the Hippodrome, the Blue mosque and Agia Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: RaySatie
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my daughter and her fiancÃ© for two nights. I travel for business very often in the North America and I have not seen any hotel staff and managers that would help the guests as we experienced there.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Harmony Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: cliffonbluecotton
Reviews.Content: We booked through Asia Rooms as we've had very good success with them. This hotel is still remodeling but what's finished is very good. Staff -Helpful -all speak english +plus other languages- very helpful with anything you want or need. Easy walking distance to major sites in the old city, restaurants, ATMs, etc. They can arrange transport to/from airports, bus station etc. Free buffet breakfast, coffee, tea, toast, eggs, fruits etc.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service superb staff, and room.”
Reviews.Author: Missmatching
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during our time in Turkey and both times it was spot on. Staff extremely polite and helpful. Room clean and bathroom also was clean, great hotwater. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Rigid staff, rail track next door, & steep climb to blue mosque”
Reviews.Author: pakistanitraveller
Reviews.Content: after staying three nights at the fabulous sultan's eye comfort, this was an anticlimax, despite the fact that no pets allowed, they had a raucous parrot right in the lobby. i came to istanbul on my flight back from switzerland just to spend time with a male friend,b ut i was not even allowed to take him to my room, which caused a huge embarassment. not recommended, as the surroundings are too noisy. trains pass by all night. plus its a 1.5 km uphill climb (not for the fainthearted) to the blue mosque. and the wifi is extremely slow.....

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gerard_E
Reviews.Content: I never expect much from boutique hotels, yet this was an exception. Staff experienced, helpful and friendly. A descent place within walking distance to most attractions in the city. Short distance to traditional and international eateries and night life, and a small yet quiet room to have a calm nap after all. No charge for the parking and wire/less access. We really enjoyed our 3 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Calm Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janan1953
Reviews.Content: Harmony hotel is a very nice place to stay in. The rooms are clean and well serviced The location is very near to Marmora sea, the view is very nice. All the staff are friendly, and treating people sincerely.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous....Fabuleux”
Reviews.Author: Julien84
Reviews.Content: Rarely were we given the occasion of enjoying our stay in such a way.... Truly, this establishment did everything to ease our stay and gave us the most pleasing standards. The staff gave us a warm welcome, proved to be friendly and quite helpful. The rooms were very comfortable, the terrace offered an amazing view and made our stay even cosier...The proximity of historical and cultural sites also was a great asset to our stay! The hotel's location is very centralized and, in a sense, perfect. I must admit that it is with sorrow that we left... For such a price, I recommend this hotel at all costs! Rarement avons-nous eu l'occasion d'apprÃ©cier notre sÃ©jour d'une telle faÃ§on... En toute honnÃªtetÃ©, cet Ã©tablissement Ã  fait tout son possible pour faciliter notre sÃ©jour en nous offrant les conditions les plus agrÃ©ables. Le personnel nous a accueilli chaleureusement, s'est montrÃ© amical et trÃ¨s serviable. Les chambres furent en effet trÃ¨s confortable, la terrasse offrait un panorama Ã©poustouflant ce qui rendit notre sÃ©jour d'autant plus agrÃ©able... La proximitÃ© avec les sites historiques et touristiques fut aussi trÃ¨s avantageux Ã  notre sÃ©jour! L'emplacement de l'hÃ´tel est trÃ¨s central et, d'une certaine faÃ§on, idyllique. Nous devons avouer que c'est avec grand regret que nous avons quittÃ© l'hÃ´tel... Pour un tel prix, je recommande cet hÃ´tel Ã  tous prix!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: squirrel84
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Harmony Hotel for 4 nights. We had what I believe was one of their 'premiere' rooms which is basically bigger than the standard room- I saw one of the standard rooms and they are very small. It was a nice size and had good facilities, with a little balcony and view of the sea. Also very clean and the cleaner changed our sheets and towels every day which was an unexpected bonus. The road outside is very noisy and busy during the day, though with the balcony doors shut you cannot really hear very much- in the winter this is fine, though in the summer it could be a problem. The manager was very helpful and hospitable, the other staff were pleasant. The hotel has a resident parrot! which is entertaining though quite noisy at times- we could hear her from our room on the top floor! we did not mind though this may not be the case for people who are not too fond of parrots! The breakfast was nice though the same every day, the managers wife (I do not know her name) makes delicious scrambled eggs! It was a little strange for us as we were the only guests for the 1st 2 nights so it felt very much that the staff were 'waiting' for us to vacate the room for cleaning each day, and for us to have breakfast. On the 3rd night some other guests arrived and were put in the room right next door to us- one warning- the walls are very thin and the tiled floors are very noisy with other guests around- these particular guests were very noisy and we could hear everything (!) I have worked in the hotel industry for the past 9 years and felt that as the hotel only had 2 rooms occupied, it seemed a bit silly to put the new guests right next door to us where they could be heard by all. it was my birthday on our day of arrival and the manager kindly gave us a complimentary bottle of wine. The hotel has a 'mini bar' in the bedrooms with soft drinks. I believe the hotel has a bar on the roof terrace which I assume is open during the summer months. We brought in our own alcohol and got told off by the female receptionist for requesting a cork screw- which was actually to open the wine they gave me for my birthday! so we just bought our own bottle opener from a local shop and kept it to our selves! A couple of small niggles- The manager made a reservation for a local fish restaurant in town which he personally reccommended saying it was owned by a 'friend' of his. We had somebody from the restaurant pick us up to take us there... The restaurant was right on the water front in town, though when we arrived we felt it was fairly impersonal and lacked atmosphere. The wine was very expensive (cheapest bottle was around Â£40) and the menu was not very varied. We are not cheapskates though are always looking for something 'different' and this was not our choice. We politely left money for the bread and olives we were given on arrival and made our excuses and left, the staff seemed a bit upset by the fact that we weren't impressed, though we tried to reassure them that it was not their fault- This is just a cautionary word to anyone who stays at the harmony hotel and is reccommended this restaurant. There are so many restaurants in Istanbul with alot more character and variety- wine is generally quite pricey in instanbul....maybe in england we are too spoilt with cheap booze! Also the manager booked us on a day tour which both myself, and my boyfriend understood to be priced as turkish lire... it was actually in euros and we swiftly got off of the coach when we realised and did the tour ourseleves for alot less money- the hotel is brilliantly conveniently situated for all the main attractions for sight seeing in Istanbul. The free airport transfer was a great bonus and the manager offered us the room untill 3pm on our last day without us asking! though the hotel was empty so I guess that is why he was so generous. I would reccommend this hotel to people who are easy going and like a friendly service without any fancyness and too much expectation, this way you will be pleasantly suprised!

Reviews.Title: “Harmony hotel manager and staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: 186338Sunshinekenbar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel for 1 month in january 2010 the manager Selcuk and staff were friendly and helpful, excellent service, we will be staying there again in Decembe this Year 2010 the Hotel is clean, and breakfast excellent, large TV, comfortable room , we were made to feel like part of the family, we were very happy there we recomend the hotel for family and every one . Ken and Ayse London England.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly stay in harmony hotel”
Reviews.Author: salma1011
Reviews.Content: we came in the middle of the night on the 9/10/10after we let down by other hotel called( fatima sultan ) , we found harmony hotel staff are very wellcomming and friendly ,we didnot have any reservation ,yet we where wellcome ,good stay very good standered of service , desent breakfast in the morning , maintained good cleaninng servise throw our stay ..staff where helpfull in explaing the attraction area around sultan ahmed area . . over all i we enjoued our 5 days stay in harmony hotel ,i will really recommend it for stay Dr.ibrahim and Mr.Elnour

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TriciaCooper
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, friendly personal hotel. I stayed for 4 days with friends while studying abroad. The staff was very helpful when planning our daily outings. It was lovely having our morning breakfast out on the terrace. Tricia Cooper

Reviews.Title: “Not in the least bit harmonious”
Reviews.Author: deenoonan
Reviews.Content: The room we were given can best be described as staff quarters! it was in the block next to the main building, and i really can't see how they thought it was fit for guests. I complained immediately and they were quite civil but had nothing to offer until Saturday night, which meant three nights in the most depressing room I have ever seen. So we found the amazing 'Romantic Hotel', charming room, lovely lovely staff - and paid for two night s(which is all they had available). When we arrived back on the second day to collect more of our stuff, having spent the night at the Romantic, they did seem genuinely upset that the state of the room made us pay for a separate hotel, and moved us to another room for two nights - but it was in basement, there was no air, no view, it was better but not good enough. So we still stayed in the lovely Romantic Hotel, went back to basement room for one night, and then was upgraded for our remaining two nights. This room, was not great either - tiny, leaky shower, the noise from people coming up and down the stairs (tiled, not carpeted) woke us on numerous occasions. Overall not a pleasant experience, I would not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: bluebadge
Reviews.Content: Located right in the cenre for all main sight seeing. The staff were very helpful and rooms if small were adequate for our needs. Rooms at the front were noisy from road traffic but hey have plans to resolve that.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: dortheneergaard
Reviews.Content: Family hotel within walking distance to several cultural places and restaurants. We have never met such an outstanding hospitality and friendlyness in our lives - we travel a lot. The personel on the hotel are extremely nice and helpfull. Please abstract from local traffic - visit the hotel anyway - you wont regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Mathilde076
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for a week. We enjoyed it a lot. The hotel is situated in Sultanhamet, Istanbul's hirstoric area so it is very closed to the Blue Mosque and St Sofia. Our room, which had a small balcony, was spacious and very clean. In the morning, there is a buffet for the breakfast (which is included in the price of the room), with a variety of food (bread, cheese, tomatoes, olives, watermelons, cereals, hot beverages, drink beverages...), we used to eat it on the terrace, which has a view on the sea of Marmara ... that was a good start for the day: nice breakfast, nice view! The staff is VERY helpful and polite, always smiling. If I go back to Istanbul, I will go back to this hotel, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL, NICE LOCATION, VERY NICE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: DrAbdulaziz
Reviews.Content: The hospitality was awesome by the host's, very helpful with everything. Extremely friendly and went out of their way to keep us entertained! They give you a helping hand in everything I stayed in this hotel for 6 days during my vacation in Istanbul. The hotel staff were very friendly and welcoming specially the hotel manager Mr.SelÃ§uk. The room was very clean comfortable with nice furniture. Bathroom was alright (there's a hairdryer,an assortment of bathroom lotion,conditioner.Rooftop balcony for evening drinks was good ..Rooftop balcony for evening drinks was good. This hotel is located near the historical places about 500 meters and the tram station is nearby with about 5 minutes walk . Breakfast was enjoyable thou its almost the same everyday. Unfortunately there were no Arabic channels . Finally I highly advice visitors of Istanbul to stay in this hotel as they will have a very nice memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great management and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scmda
Reviews.Content: very very clean hotel! this is my 9th trip to turkey in the past 6 years, and one thing to rave about, best shower i have ever seen or used in turkey! actual water pressure and a great shower head! Day we checked in, greeted warmly by the hotel staff, and through the 4 days we stayed there, nothing could have been better! Hotel is very clean, charming, unpretentious and in a great location! only 5-10 minute walk to the to blue mosque and maybe 20 min walk to the grand bazaar, restaurants everywhere! On last day, checked out, left luggage and went sight seeing, upon return, while waiting for a friend to pick me up, Selcuk invited me to the rooftop terrace were we shared a drink and had a wonderful conversation for about 40 minutes, very charming guy and his English is excellent! could have stayed for hours and chatted with him, but it was time for me to go. I have been all over Turkey, i have stayed in everything from a $750.00 per night hotel to a $40.00 per night hotels and i must say, this one one of of my favorites, they treat everyone great, unlike some hotels who only kiss up to the russians, Germans, British, and treat their own Turkish people like second class citizens (I'm American, fiancee Turkish, we see it everywhere, and since I'm with a turk, i get ignored too). If you have the chance to stay here, you will not regret it one bit! And the price is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and attentive staff and great value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JudiSF
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful find this hotel was. Our room was spotless and well lighted, with a super clean bathroom, air conditioning, brand new sheets and towels, very comfortable beds, and a little balcony with windows opening out onto the street. If you stay three nights or more they add in a free pickup at the airport. There is a large breakfast every morning with several cheeses, meats, olives, toast, more types of jam than I knew existed, eggs, fresh fruits and vegetables, etc. The owner, Selcuk, is a real gentleman. All the staff were very friendly, assisting us with taxis, site recommendations, good restaurants, and just generally welcoming us each time we entered, offering tea and making sure we were enjoying Istanbul. There is also a roof terrace. The hotel is close to everything and has a convenience store at the corner that is open late where you can buy water and snacks. It is on the west side of Sultanahmet; we liked that it was quieter than the very center part. You can hear the train, but actually the call to prayer is just as loud. I wore earplugs (as I did all over Turkey) and heard neither. I recommend this hotel as a comfortable, friendly and convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel in the historic area of istanbul”
Reviews.Author: adversaryintrospect
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and tidy. It has a wonderful manager who is particularly helpful. They assisted me in anything I asked for, and I thought they offered a reasonable price. I would recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Harmony Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Kucuk Ayasofya Mahallesi Aksakal Sokak No:26 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
